attributes.action: Introduce compulsary philosophy education into the national curriculum as part of secondary education
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I believe that philosophy is being neglected by the compulsary
    educational system and is leading young people to become
    confused and to have weak arguing skills. In addition it is my
    belief that the religious education system as it is at the
    moment is flawed in many aspects and has no clear objective, and leaves most atheist students very bored and mocking of religion. I
    understand that these are seperate issues and I cannot truly
    comment on the reasons for this but I strongly urge the
    government to review this situation and to consider the
    advantages of teaching philosophy as a priority over RE. I left
    school 2 years ago and although my school had a fully qualified
    philosophy teacher, we were only ever given eight
    philosophy lessons, and were given many hundreds of R.E.
    lessons by the same teacher. There are many reasons to
    introduce philosophy into the national curriculum that I would
    not be able to do justice within the 1000 character limit here; it needs discussion.
